author: Eric Hal Schwartz
description: A Microsoft ad on LinkedIn is getting roasted for using a terrible AI-generated graphic to promote a graphic designer role at Xbox.
title: Microsoft employee uses terrible AI-generated image to advertise for Xbox artists just weeks after massive layoffs

author: Mike Moore
description: Kiro from AWS looks to help developers cut through the chaos of vibe coding.

description: A long-ignored flaw in US train systems allows remote braking with cheap radios, raising serious safety concerns after over a decade of denial and delay.

author: Craig Hale
description: New research highlights how enterprises aren't ready to benefit from AI, especially when it comes to security and governance.
title: A quarter of applications now include AI, but enterprises still aren't ready to reap the benefits

author: Wayne Williams
description: Former Dyson engineer builds low-cost holographic storage with polymer ribbon which works seamlessly inside existing LTO libraries.
title: Ex-Dyson engineer to launch LTO tape holographic rival that uses cheap $5 laser diode, promises 200TB cartridges on 100m reels — but read/write speeds are unknown

description: From Shakespeare to parenting: Google’s NotebookLM debuts themed ‘Featured Notebooks’ with The Economist & The Atlantic.

description: After Nick Frost promised his version of Hagrid wouldn’t be anything like Robbie Coltrane’s, the first look at the HBO Harry Potter TV show version is… unexpected.

author: Demi Williams
description: A Nintendo Switch 2 owner is warning players about buying pre-owned physical games after being banned for unknowingly playing cloned copies.

author: Craig Hale
description: Despite making H20 chips specifically for China, Nvidia was banned from exporting them, but that's about to change.
